text: in this video you'll see how to upgrade
from cloud endur Disaster Recovery or
CDR to AWS elastic Disaster Recovery or
AWS DRS using downloadable tools you can
determine server upgrade eligibility
upgrade each machine to DRS in two steps
and keep CDR protection until the
upgrade is
finalized AWS DRS is the next generation
of CDR and is the recommended service to
use for Disaster Recovery to
AWS the CDR to DRS upgrade assessment
tool and the server UPG up tool fully
automate the upgrade process and ensure
full protection from end to
end certain prerequisites must be met
prior to upgrading from CDR to DRS for
demonstration purposes we have already
taken care of these you can learn more
about the prerequisites in the
description and links for this
video we'll begin in the cloud andure
console where we have a source server to
upgrade let's take a
look here is the machine's blueprint
upgrade eligibility is determined based
upon AWS support for the machine's
Target AWS region replication settings
blueprint settings and operating system
let's collect some information about
this project that we'll need in order to
run the
tools we'll note the Project's API token
as well as the project ID in its
URL now let's run a command to download
the assessment tool the tools can be run
in either windows or Linux we'll be
using Linux the assessment tool can be
run from any machine that has access to
the internet and it needs to be run once
once per
project here we'll apply permissions so
that we can execute the
file we'll specify the API token and
project ID we
noted now the tool will go through some
validations and provide us with the
assessment
results any findings are saved to an
output folder in the directory where the
tool was installed a CSV file lists the
warnings and errors and provides
instructions for how to mitigate them
you can learn more about these findings
in the links for this video in this case
there were no findings
now that we've confirmed eligibility
we'll download the server upgrade tool
we'll apply permissions as
before phase one is to start the upgrade
to run the start upgrade command we'll
need the API token and project ID again
plus the AWS access key ID and AWS
secret access key for the IM am user
with permissions for the server upgrade
tool this command installs the DRS agent
in add dorant state so it doesn't
replicate we're passing additional
options that activate copying of
replication and blueprint settings and
of a snapshot to be used for a drill on
DRS the tool will identify all the
volumes on the servers and then download
and install the new AWS replication
agent next it will import the snapshot
from CDR into DRS for testing
purposes the installation was successful
let's find the server in
DRS we can initiate a drill instance to
see if the launch template settings are
correct
while the recovery job is creating the
drill instance let's check the cloud
indoor
console notice that we still have
continuous data protection in
CDR let's move on to phase two in which
we finalize the upgrade to
DRS in the finalized upgrade phase the
AWS replication agent that was installed
on the server in the previous phase is
activated and a seed snapshot is
imported from CDR for replication to
allow the new source server to perform a
rescan which shortens the time it takes
the server to reach protected status in
DRS when the upgrade is complete the
tool uninstalls the CDR
agent in the cloud inter console we now
see that the server is replicating with
DRS rather than CDR during the upgrade
we can still launch Target machines in
CDR from retained snapshots but all new
snapshots will be taken in DRS let's
check the DRS
console the rescan is complete and the
has reached the ready for Recovery
status The Source server is now fully
protected in DRS CDR machines should be
removed when there are no more needed
snapshots for that machine on CDR
projects without machines should also be
deleted you've just seen how to upgrade
from CDR to
DRS you can learn more about this topic
in the description and links for this
video thanks for watching now it's your
turn to try
